intro: Embelia kinabaluensis, commonly known as the Kinabalu embelia, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of Borneo. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within montane forests. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
